com.terradue.ogf.saga.impl.job
Class JobImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.terradue.ogf.saga.impl.job.JobImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, org.ogf.saga.attributes.AsyncAttributes<org.ogf.saga.job.Job>, org.ogf.saga.attributes.Attributes, org.ogf.saga.job.Job, org.ogf.saga.monitoring.Callback, org.ogf.saga.monitoring.Monitorable, org.ogf.saga.permissions.Permissions<org.ogf.saga.job.Job>, org.ogf.saga.SagaObject, org.ogf.saga.task.Async, org.ogf.saga.task.Task<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void>
public class JobImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.ogf.saga.job.Job, org.ogf.saga.monitoring.Callback

The JobImpl class is an array of n jobs. It provides the exact same operations and attributes as per Job interface but performs the operations aggregated for all jobs it contains JobImpl is created by a JobService, using a JobDescription. The JobImpl class simply include an array of Job accessible publicly.

Version:
$Revision: -1 $
Author:
$Author: $

Adds a callback to the specified metric.

Specified by:
addCallback in interface org.ogf.saga.monitoring.Monitorable
Parameters:
jobState - identifier the metric to which the callback is to be added.
m - the callback to be added.
Returns:
a handle to be used for removal of the callback.
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - is thrown if the implementation does not provide an implementation of this method.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException - is thrown when operation failed because none of the available session contexts could successfully be used for authentication.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException - is thrown when none of the available contexts of the used session could be used for successful authorization. This error indicates that the resource could not be accessed at all, and not that an operation was not available due to restricted permissions.
org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException - is thrown when the method failed because the identity used did not have sufficient permissions to perform the operation successfully.
org.ogf.saga.error.DoesNotExistException - is thrown when a metric with the specified name does not exist.
org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException - is thrown when a remote operation did not complete successfully because the network communication or the remote service timed out.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException - is thrown if the specified metric has mode "Final".

cancel

public void cancel()
            throws org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException,
                   org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                   org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException,
                   org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException
Cancels all the jobs. This is a non-blocking version, which may continue to try and cancel the jobs in the background. The job array state will remain RUNNING until the cancel operation succeeds.

Specified by:
cancel in interface org.ogf.saga.task.Task<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Void>
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - is thrown if the implementation does not provide an implementation of this method.
org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException - is thrown when a remote operation did not complete successfully because the network communication or the remote service timed out.
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException - is thrown when the task is in NEW state.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.

findAttributes

public java.lang.String[] findAttributes(java.lang.String... patterns)
                                  throws org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException,
                                         org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException
Description copied from interface: org.ogf.saga.attributes.Attributes
Finds matching attributes. This method accepts a list of patterns, and returns a list of keys for those attributes that match any one of the specified patterns. The allowed patterns describe both attribute keys and values, and are formatted as key-pattern=value-pattern. Both the key-pattern value-pattern can contain wildcards. The value-pattern can be empty, and the method will then return all attribute keys which match the key-pattern. The equal sign = can then be omitted from the pattern.

Specified by:
findAttributes in interface org.ogf.saga.attributes.Attributes
Parameters:
patterns - the search patterns.
Returns:
the list of matching attribute keys.
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - is thrown if the implementation does not provide an implementation of this method.
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - is thrown when one ore more of the specified patterns are not correctly formatted.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException - is thrown when operation failed because none of the available session contexts could successfully be used for authentication.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException - is thrown when none of the available contexts of the used session could be used for successful authorization. This error indicates that the resource could not be accessed at all, and not that an operation was not available due to restricted permissions.
org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException - is thrown when the method failed because the identity used did not have sufficient permissions to perform the operation successfully.
org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException - is thrown when a remote operation did not complete successfully because the network communication or the remote service timed out.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.

org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException - is thrown when operation failed because none of the available session contexts could successfully be used for authentication.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException - is thrown when none of the available contexts of the used session could be used for successful authorization. This error indicates that the resource could not be accessed at all, and not that an operation was not available due to restricted permissions.
org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException - is thrown when the method failed because the identity used did not have sufficient permissions to perform the operation successfully.
